headline.main: 36 TONS OF BOMBS SHOWERED ON LAE; Japanese Base on Coast of New Guinea Undergoes Its Heaviest Raid

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS in Australia, Tuesday, June 1 (U.P.) -- Allied heavy bombers dropped thirty-six tons of bombs yesterday on enemy targets at Lae, Japanese coastal base in New Guinea, a communique said today. An official spokesman said that it was the heaviest bomb load ever dumped on Lae.
abstract: Allied bombers blast Lae; raid Langgur airdrome, Kei Islands, and Finschhafen; Jap convoy believed to have landed some reinforcements, Hansa Bay area
